I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

lb_mask_binary_le : forall l m : lb, l ⪯ m -> ⟦ l ⟧ ≲ ⟦ m ⟧

lb_ortho_sind : forall P : lb -> lb -> SProp, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, P l nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x = ⟘ \/ y = ⟘ -> l ⟂ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⟂ l0 -> P l l0

lb_mask_ind : forall P : lb -> lb -> Prop, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> P l nil -> P (⟘ :: l) nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⪯ l0 -> P l l0
Inductive lb_mask : lb -> lb -> Prop := in_lb_mask_0 : forall l : lb, nil ⪯ l | in_lb_mask_1 : forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil | in_lb_mask_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m Arguments lb_mask (_ _)%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_0 _%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_1 [l]%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_2 (_ _)%bool_scope [l m]%list_scope

ZifyClasses.mkrel : forall (S T : Type) (R : S -> S -> Prop) (I : S -> T) (TR : T -> T -> Prop), (forall n m : S, R n m <-> TR (I n) (I m)) -> forall (s1 : S) (t1 : T), I s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S) (t2 : T), I s2 = t2 -> R s1 s2 < -> TR t1 t2
lb_pointwise = fun f : bool -> bool -> bool => fix lb_pointwise (l m : lb) {struct l} : lb := match l with | nil => match m with | nil => nil | _ :: _ => map (f ⟘) m end | x :: l0 => match m with | nil => map (fun x0 : bool => f x0 ⟘) l | y :: m0 => f x y :: lb_pointwise l0 m0 end end : (bool -> bool -> bool) -> lb -> lb -> lb Arguments lb_pointwise _%function_scope (_ _)%list_scope
lb_meet = lb_pointwise andb : lb -> lb -> lb Arguments lb_meet (_ _)%list_scope
lb_join = lb_pointwise orb : lb -> lb -> lb Arguments lb_join (_ _)%list_scope
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.Z0 | S n0 => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_nat _%nat_scope
BinNatDef.N.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.N0 | S n' => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n') end : nat -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.of_nat _%nat_scope
g_nlb_sind : forall P : nat -> lb -> SProp, P 0 nil -> (forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 0 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> P (div n 2) l -> P n (⟘ :: l)) -> (forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 1 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> P (div n 2) l -> P n (⟙ :: l)) -> forall (n : nat) (l : lb), g_nlb n l -> P n l
g_nlb_ind : forall P : nat -> lb -> Prop, P 0 nil -> (forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 0 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> P (div n 2) l -> P n (⟘ :: l)) -> (forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 1 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> P (div n 2) l -> P n (⟙ :: l)) -> forall (n : nat) (l : lb), g_nlb n l -> P n l
lb_nat = fix lb_nat (l : lb) : nat := match l with | nil => 0 | x :: l0 => bool2nat x + 2 * lb_nat l0 end : lb -> nat Arguments lb_nat _%list_scope
Ascii.N_of_digits = fix N_of_digits (l : lb) : BinNums.N := match l with | nil => BinNums.N0 | b :: l' => BinNat.N.add (if b then BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH else BinNums.N0) (BinNat.N.mul (BinNums.Npos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) (N_of_digits l')) end : lb -> BinNums.N Arguments Ascii.N_of_digits _%list_scope
